translated: Eleven-faced
Om, homage to all Buddhas and Bodhisattvas!

original: evaṃ mayā śrutamekasamaye bhagavān śrāvastyāṃ viharati sma karīramaṇḍale ca /
analyzed: evam mayā śrutam eka samaye bhagavān śrāvastyām viharati sma karīra maṇḍale ca
translated: Thus have I heard at one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Shravasti, in the Kiree Mandala.

original: atha khalvāryāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nekavidyādharakoṭīniyutaśatasahastrastreṇa parivṛto yena bhagavāṃstenopasamakrāmat /
analyzed: atha khalu ārya avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ neka vidyādhara koṭī niyuta śata sahastra astreṇa parivṛtaḥ yena bhagavān tena upasamakrāmat
translated: Then indeed the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Noble Avalokiteshvara, surrounded by many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of Vidyadharas, approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtyaekānte nyasīda bhagavantametadavocat /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ekānte nyasīda bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One, and sat to one side. He said this to the Blessed One:

original: idaṃ mama bhagavannekādaśamukhaṃ nāma hṛdayamekādaśabhiḥ kalpakoṭībhirbhāṣitam /
analyzed: idam mama bhagavan ekādaśamukham nāma hṛdayam ekādaśabhiḥ kalpa koṭībhiḥ bhāṣitam
translated: Blessed One, this eleven-faced heart of mine, named Ekadasamukha, was spoken by me in eleven kotis of kalpas.

original: ahaṃ cettarhi bhāṣiṣyāmi sarvasattvānāmarthāya hitāya sukhāya sarvavyādhipraśamanāya
analyzed: aham ced tarhi bhāṣiṣyāmi sarva sattvānām arthāya hitāya sukhāya sarva vyādhi praśamanāya
translated: If I now speak it, it is for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of all beings, for the pacification of all illnesses,

analyzed: sarva pāpa alakṣmi duḥsvapna pratinivāraṇāya sarva akāla mṛtyu pratinivāraṇāya aprasādānām
translated: for the prevention of all inauspicious dreams and nightmares, for the prevention of untimely death, for the faith of those without faith,
for the pacification of all obstacles and Vinayakas.
I do not see, Blessed One, he said.

original: sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāḥ prajāyā yadanena hṛdayena🔽rakṣe kṛte paritre parigrahe śāntisvastyayane daṇḍaparihare śastraparihare viṣaprahāṇe
analyzed: sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikāyāḥ prajāyāḥ yat anena hṛdayena  rakṣe kṛte paritre parigrahe śānti svastyayane daṇḍa parihare śastra parihare viṣa prahāṇe
translated: I do not see, Blessed One, in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans, one who could transgress this heart-essence.

original: kṛte yaḥ kaścidatikramet na praśamet nedaṃsthānaṃ vidyate sthāptya paurāṇāṃ karma vipacyate /
analyzed: kṛte yaḥ kaścid atikramet na praśamet na idam sthānam vidyate paurāṇām karma vipacyate
translated: If it is recited, protected, guarded, kept, pacified, made well, punished, avoided with a stick, avoided with a weapon, or avoided with poison, there is no place for it to transgress. It will not happen. Only one's own past karma will ripen.

original: tadasya ca kalpayato 'bhiśraddadhataḥ sarveṇa sarvaṃ na bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tat asya ca kalpayataḥ bhiśraddadhataḥ sarveṇa sarvam na bhaviṣyati
translated: And for one who imagines this and has faith in it, all will not happen.

analyzed: sarva buddha stutaḥ samanvāhṛtaḥ yam hṛdayam sarva tathāgata anumoditaḥ yam hṛdayam
translated: This heart-essence is praised by all Buddhas, contemplated by all Tathāgatas, and approved by all Tathāgatas.

original: smarāmyahaṃ bhagavan gaṅgānadīvālukāsamānāṃ kalpānāṃ pareṇa śatapadmanayanacūḍapratihataraṅgavelakiraṇarājasya nāma tathāgatasya /
analyzed: smarāmi aham bhagavan gaṅgā nadī vālukā samānām kalpānām pareṇa śatapadmanayanacūḍa pratihata raṅgavelakiraṇarājasya nāma tathāgatasya
translated: I remember, Blessed One, beyond eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River, the Tathāgata named Śatapadmanayanacūḍapratihataraṅgavela-kiraṇarāja.

analyzed: mayā tathāgatasya antike śruta mayam hṛdayam udgṛhītam ca
translated: I heard this heart-essence from that Tathāgata and received it.

original: saha pratilaṃbhena daśasu dikṣu sarvatathāgatāḥ Em
analyzed: saha pratilaṃbhena daśasu dikṣu sarva tathāgatāḥ em
translated: Immediately, in the ten directions, all Tathāgatas
They will attain the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: evaṃ bahukaro 'yaṃ hṛdayam tasmāttarhi śrāddhena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā satkṛtyāyaṃ hṛdayaṃ sādhayitavyam /
analyzed: evam bahu karaḥ yam hṛdayam tasmāt tarhi śrāddhena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā satkṛtya ayam hṛdayam sādhayitavyam
translated: Thus, this heart mantra is very beneficial. Therefore, a faithful son or daughter of good family should practice this heart mantra with respect.
With a one-pointed mind, it should always be practiced.
Having risen at dawn, it should be recited one hundred and eight times.
Ten qualities of this very life should be accepted.
What are the ten?
Namely, one will be free from illness.
One will be accepted by all the Tathagatas.

analyzed: dhana dhānya hiraṇya ābharaṇam asya akṣayam bhaviṣyati
translated: One's wealth, grain, gold, and ornaments will be inexhaustible.
All enemies will be subdued and defeated.
In the royal assembly, one will be considered the foremost speaker.

original: na viṣaṃ na garaṃ na jvaraṃ na śastraṃ kāye kramiṣyati /
analyzed: na viṣam na garam na jvaram na śastram kāye kramiṣyati
translated: Poison, poison-food, fever, or weapons will not affect one's body.
One will not die by drowning.
One will not die by fire.

analyzed: na akāla mṛtyunā kālam ca kariṣyati
translated: One will not die an untimely death.
Four other qualities and benefits will be accepted.
At the time of death, they will see the Tathāgata.
They will not be reborn in the lower realms.

analyzed: na viṣama a parihāreṇa kālam kariṣyati
translated: They will not die without avoiding misfortune.
And after passing away, they will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

original: smarāmyahaṃ bhagavanniti daśānāṃ gaṅgānadīvālukāsamānāṃ kalpānāṃ tataḥ pareṇa paratareṇa mandāravagandho nāma tathāgato 'bhūt /
analyzed: smarāmi aham bhagavan iti daśānām gaṅgā nadī vālukā samānām kalpānām tatas pareṇa paratareṇa mandāravagandhaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ bhūt
translated: Blessed One, I remember that ten eons ago, even further back, there was a Tathāgata named Mandāravagandha.

analyzed: tatra mayā gṛha paribhūtena ayam udgṛhītam
translated: At that time, I, being a householder, received this [dhāraṇī].

original: cattvāriṃśat kalpasahastrāṇi saṃsārāḥ paścānmukhīkṛtāḥ /🔽eṣa ca mayā hṛdayaṃ pravartitvā sarvasmin karuṇāyanajñānagarbhabodhisattvavimokṣaṃ Em
analyzed: cattvāriṃśat kalpa sahastrāṇi saṃsārāḥ paścāt mukhīkṛtāḥ  eṣa ca mayā hṛdayam pravartitvā sarvasmin karuṇāyana jñāna garbha bodhisattva vimokṣam em
translated: For forty thousand eons, I turned away from saṃsāra.
And having caused this heart [dhāraṇī] to be practiced, I attained the bodhisattva liberation called the womb of knowledge of universal compassion.

original: ye bandhanabaddhā ye badhyaprāptā ye udakāgnivividhaduḥkhābhyāhatāḥ tadanenāhaṃ sarvasattvānāṃ layanaṃ trāṇaṃ śaraṇaṃ parāyaṇaṃ bhavāmi /
analyzed: ye bandhana baddhāḥ ye badhya prāptāḥ ye udaka agni vividha duḥkha abhyāhatāḥ tat anena aham sarva sattvānām layanam trāṇam śaraṇam parāyaṇam bhavāmi
translated: I become a refuge, a protector, a support, and a final relief for all beings who are bound in prison, who are about to be executed, who are afflicted by various sufferings such as water, fire, and so forth.

original: yat sarvaduṣṭayakṣarākṣasānāmanena hṛdayena karṣitvā maitracittān dayācittān kṛtvānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayāmi /
analyzed: yat sarva duṣṭa yakṣa rākṣasānām anena hṛdayena karṣitvā maitra cittān dayā cittān kṛtvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayāmi
translated: By attracting all the evil yakshas and rakshasas with this heart-mantra, I establish them in the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment with a mind of loving-kindness and a mind of compassion.

analyzed: evam mahardhikaḥ yam mama bhagavan hṛdayam
translated: Thus, Blessed One, this heart-mantra of mine is very powerful.

original: ekavelāṃ prakāśitvā cattvāro mūlāpattayaḥ kṣayaṃ gacchanti pacānantaryāṇi karmāṇi niravayavaṃ tanvīkariṣyanti /
analyzed: eka velām prakāśitvā cattvāraḥ mūla āpattayaḥ kṣayam gacchanti paca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi niravayavam tanvīkariṣyanti
translated: By reciting it once, the four root downfalls are destroyed, and the five heinous actions are reduced to nothing.
What need is there to speak of those who will practice as instructed?

analyzed: aneka buddha śata sahastra avaropita kuśala mūlam bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have planted roots of merit with many hundreds of thousands of Buddhas.

analyzed: ye śroṣyanti prāk eva japa sādhana ādibhiḥ
translated: Those who will hear it, let alone those who will practice the recitation and accomplishment, etc.

original: sarvamanorathaṃ paripūrayiṣyāmi yaśca caturdaśīpaṃcadaśī māmuddiśya upavasati /
analyzed: sarva manoratham paripūrayiṣyāmi yaḥ ca caturdaśī paṃcadaśī mām uddiśya upavasati
translated: I will fulfill all their wishes. And for those who observe the fast on the fourteenth and fifteenth days in my honor,

analyzed: cattvāriṃśat kalpa sahastrāṇi saṃsārān paścāt mukhīkarisyanti
translated: they will turn their backs on the cycle of existence for forty thousand eons.

original: tena nāmadheyamapi grahaṇena bhagavan saha so 'yaṃ buddhakoṭīniyutśatasahasrātirekasamam /
analyzed: tena nāmadheyam api grahaṇena bhagavan saha saḥ yam buddha koṭī niyut śata sahasra atireka samam
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, by merely hearing the name of this heart-mantra, one will have the same merit as that of more than a hundred thousand nayutas of koṭis of Buddhas.

analyzed: mama nāmadheya grahaṇena sarva sattvāḥ a vaivartika tvam prasavanti
translated: By merely uttering my name, all beings will attain irreversibility.
They will be freed from all illnesses.

original: sarvāvaraṇebhyaḥ sarvabhayebhyaḥ sarvakāyavāṅmanoduścaritebhyaḥ parimokṣyante /🔽teṣāmeva karatalagatā Em
analyzed: sarva āvaraṇebhyaḥ sarva bhayebhyaḥ sarva kāya vāc manaḥ duścaritebhyaḥ parimokṣyante  teṣām eva kara tala gatā em
translated: They will be liberated from all obscurations, all fears, and all misdeeds of body, speech, and mind.
The enlightenment of the Buddhas will be in the palm of their hands.
The Blessed One said:

original: sādhu sādhu kulaputra yat sarvasattvānāmantike evaṃrūpā mahākaruṇā /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu kula putra yat sarva sattvānām antike evaṃrūpā mahā karuṇā
translated: Excellent, excellent, son of noble family! That you have such great compassion for all beings.

original: śakṣyasi tvaṃ kulaputraḥ anenopāyena sarvasattvānāmanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayitum /
analyzed: śakṣyasi tvam kula putraḥ anena upāyena sarva sattvānām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayitum
translated: Son of noble family, by this method you will be able to establish all beings in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.
You have accepted and rejoiced in this heart mantra.
Speak, son of noble family!

original: tataḥ khalvāryāvalokiteśvaro bodhisattva utthāyasanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṅga kṛtvā bhagavataścaraṇayoḥ praṇipatya idaṃ hṛdayamāvartayati sma /🔽namo ratnatrayāya /
analyzed: tatas khalu ārya avalokiteśvaraḥ bodhisattvaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅga kṛtvā bhagavataḥ caraṇayoḥ praṇipatya idam hṛdayam āvartayati sma  namaḥ ratnatrayāya
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Noble Avalokiteśvara rose from his seat, put his upper robe over one shoulder, bowed at the feet of the Blessed One, and uttered this heart mantra:🔽Homage to the Three Jewels.
Homage to the Tathāgata Vairocana.

analyzed: namaḥ ārya avalokiteśvarāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya mahā kāruṇikāya
translated: Homage to the noble Avalokiteshvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, the One with Great Compassion.

analyzed: namaḥ atīta anāgata pratyutpannebhyaḥ sarva tathāgatebhyaḥ rhad bhyaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhebhyaḥ
translated: Homage to all the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones, past, future, and present.
Om dhara dhara.
Dhiri dhiri.
Dhuru dhuru.
Itte vItte.
Chale chale.
Pracale pracale.
Kusume kusumavare.
Ili mili viti svaha.
Thus is the root mantra.
Homage to the Three Jewels.
Homage to the noble Avalokiteshvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.
Thus: Haha haha.

original: ime tile cile bhile khile svāhā /
analyzed: ime tile cile bhile khile svāhā
translated: These: tile chile bile khille svaha.

analyzed: snāna upasparśana vastra abhyukṣipaṇa mantraḥ sapta jāpena
translated: The mantra for sprinkling oneself, one's clothes, and bathing after recitation seven times.
Homage to the Three Jewels.
Homage to the noble Avalokiteshvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.

original: tadyathā ṭuru ṭuru hā hā hā hā svāhā /
analyzed: tat yathā ṭuru ṭuru hā hā hā hā svāhā
translated: Thus: turu turu ha ha ha ha svaha.
The mantra for offering incense and lamps.
Homage to the Three Jewels.
Homage to the noble Avalokiteshvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being.

original: tadyathā thiri thiri dhiri dhiri svāhā /
analyzed: tat yathā thiri thiri dhiri dhiri svāhā
translated: Namely, thiri thiri dhiri dhiri svāhā.
The mantra for offering incense and flowers.
Homage to the Three Jewels.

analyzed: namaḥ ārya avalokiteśvaraya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya mahā kāruṇikāya
translated: Homage to the noble Avalokiteśvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, the One with Great Compassion.

original: tadyathā sāde sāde sidi sidi sudu sudu svāhā /
analyzed: tat yathā sāde sāde sidi sidi sudu sudu svāhā
translated: Namely, sāde sāde sidi sidi sudusudusvāhā.
The mantra for offering strength, recited twenty-one times.
Homage to the Three Jewels.
Homage to the noble Avalokiteśvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being,
the One with Great Compassion.

original: tadyathā yasi ddhasi cari huru icuruḥ suruḥ muruḥ svāhā /
analyzed: tat yathā yasi ddhasi cari huru icuruḥ suruḥ muruḥ svāhā
translated: Namely, yasi ddhasi cari huru icuru suru muru svāhā.
The mantra for homa.
With this mantra, one should recite the names of one's relatives.

original: ragniṃ prajvālya dadhimadhudhṛtābhyaktānāmahorātrauṣikena ekena triṃśatā homaḥ kāryaḥ /
analyzed: ragnim prajvālya dadhi madhu dhṛta abhyaktānām ahorātra auṣikena ekena triṃśatā homaḥ kāryaḥ
translated: Having kindled a fire, one should perform homa thirty times with sesame seeds smeared with curd, honey, and ghee, for one day and night.
Then one should commence the rite.

original: namo ratnatrayāya nama āryāvalokiteśvarāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya mahākāruṇikāya /
analyzed: namaḥ ratnatrayāya namaḥ ārya avalokiteśvarāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya mahā kāruṇikāya
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels, homage to the noble Avalokiteśvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, the One with Great Compassion.

original: tadyathā ili mili tili tili hili svāhā /
analyzed: tat yathā ili mili tili tili hili svāhā
translated: Namely, ili mili tili tili hili svāhā.

original: dīpābaddha udakena rvā bhasmanā vā saptajāpena /
analyzed: dīpa ābaddhaḥ udakena rvā bhasmanā vā sapta jāpena
translated: One should make a lamp with water or ashes, and recite the mantra seven times.
Homage to the Three Jewels.

analyzed: namaḥ ārya avalokiteśvarāya bodhisattvāya mahāsattvāya mahā kāruṇikāya
translated: Homage to the noble Avalokiteshvara, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, the greatly compassionate one.

original: tadyathā piṭi piṭi tiṭi tiṭi viṭi viṭi gaccha gaccha bhagavānāryāvalokiteśvara svabhavanaṃ svabhavanaṃ svāhā /
analyzed: tat yathā piṭi piṭi tiṭi tiṭi viṭi viṭi gaccha gaccha bhagavān ārya avalokiteśvara sva bhavanam sva bhavanam svāhā
translated: As follows: piti piti titi titi viti viti gaccha gaccha, O Blessed Noble Avalokiteshvara, to your own abode, to your own abode, svāhā.

analyzed: udake sapta vārān parijapya caturdiśam kṣipet
translated: Having recited over water seven times, one should sprinkle in the four directions.
O Noble Avalokiteshvara, go to your own abode.
